thread.title: Sen. Bob Casey to host town hall in Philly Sunday
thread.title_full: Sen. Bob Casey to host town hall in Philly Sunday

author: Jonathan Tamari
title: Sen. Bob Casey to host town hall in Philly Sunday
text:
Sen. Bob Casey to host town hall in Philly Sunday Updated: March 10, 2017 — 5:01 PM EST 197 Share Jonathan Tamari Washington Bureau 
Jonathan Tamari is the Washington correspondent. He writes about the lawmakers, politics, and policy that affect Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, and New Jersey. He previously covered the Eagles and the NFL. Before that he worked in Trenton, reporting on the characters and color of New Jersey state government. He lives in Washington. More by Jonathan Tamari Arrow icon 
WASHINGTON -- Sen. Bob Casey (D., Pa.) will face the public Sunday in a town hall Q-and-A in University City. 
The event will make the senator one of the few lawmakers from the Philadelphia region to host a town hall since President Trump’s election, and it comes a year before he faces what could be a challenging re-election campaign. 
Republicans have faced the most pressure to host such events, and those who have done them have often faced raucous throngs of constituents. Democratic events have drawn less scrutiny, though Republicans have made Casey a potential target in 2018 elections. 
Casey’s town hall is scheduled for 2:30 p.m. Sunday at the Penn Museum, 3260 South Street. The public forum is the first of what his office says will be a series of such events.
